questions.question: What is the Schwarzschild radius and how is it significant in the context of black holes?
options: The radius at which light can escape from a black hole
The radius at which the escape speed equals the speed of light
The minimum radius an object must have in order to become a black hole
The radius beyond which matter is condensed in a black hole
questions.correct_answer: The radius at which the escape speed equals the speed of light

questions.question: What is 'Lorentz Invariance' in the context of special relativity?
options: The constancy of the speed of light in all inertial frames
The principle that the laws of physics should look the same in all inertial frames
The invariance of physical laws under transformations between inertial frames
The fact that the spacetime interval between two events is invariant under Lorentz transformations
questions.correct_answer: The fact that the spacetime interval between two events is invariant under Lorentz transformations

questions.question: How does the concept of 'simultaneity' differ in special relativity from its understanding in classical physics?
options: In special relativity, simultaneity is relative to the observer
In special relativity, simultaneity does not exist
In special relativity, all events are simultaneous
In special relativity, simultaneity is absolute
questions.correct_answer: In special relativity, simultaneity is relative to the observer

questions.question: What is the 'Cosmic Speed Limit'?
options: The maximum speed at which information can travel
The speed of light in vacuum
The speed of gravity
Both A and B

questions.question: What are 'world lines' in the context of relativity?
options: Paths that light takes through spacetime
Paths that particles take through spacetime
Theoretical lines that define the boundary of the universe
Lines that connect points of the same time in different frames
questions.correct_answer: Paths that particles take through spacetime

questions.question: What are 'Tachyons' in the context of special relativity?
options: Particles that travel faster than light
Particles that are always at rest
Particles that have zero mass
Particles that travel backwards in time
questions.correct_answer: Particles that travel faster than light

questions.question: What is 'gravitational redshift' as predicted by the theory of general relativity?
options: The shift in the frequency of light to the red end of the spectrum as it moves away from a massive body
The shift in the frequency of light to the blue end of the spectrum as it moves towards a massive body
The shift in the frequency of light to the red end of the spectrum as it moves towards a massive body
The shift in the frequency of light to the blue end of the spectrum as it moves away from a massive body
questions.correct_answer: The shift in the frequency of light to the red end of the spectrum as it moves away from a massive body

questions.question: In the context of special relativity, what does E=mc^2 represent?
options: The energy contained within a certain amount of mass
The energy required to accelerate an object to the speed of light
The maximum energy that can be obtained from a mass
The energy required to create a certain amount of mass
questions.correct_answer: The energy contained within a certain amount of mass

questions.question: What are 'gravitational waves' according to general relativity?
options: Waves of gravity that propagate through space
Fluctuations in the density of matter
Disturbances in the curvature of spacetime
Pulses of gravitational force
questions.correct_answer: Disturbances in the curvature of spacetime

questions.question: What is 'time dilation' in the context of special relativity?
options: The apparent slowing down of time in a moving frame of reference
The apparent speeding up of time in a moving frame of reference
The difference in time measurements between observers in different frames of reference
The effect of gravity on the rate of time flow
questions.correct_answer: The apparent slowing down of time in a moving frame of reference
